text: Helcystogramma conturbata is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1933. It is found in Sierra Leone. The wingspan is about 10 mm. The forewings are whitish ochreous, the veins marked with dark fuscous lines but partially confused by some irregular dark brown suffusion between the veins, especially in the cell and a narrow irregular terminal fascia. The hindwings are grey.Exotic Microlepidoptera. 4 (12): 359. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1933 conturbata Category:Moths of Africa
title: Helcystogramma conturbata
